newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore rubber futures close higher across board.
newsitem.headline: Singapore rubber futures close higher across board.

text.p: Rubber futures closed higher across the board in moderate trade on some late buying interest in line with higher Japanese prices, brokers said on Friday.
They said prices in Tokyo and Kobe also ended firmer across the board on sporadic short-covering and position adjustments ahead of the weekend.

"The market was quiet and featureless in the morning due mainly to an absence of fresh incentives. But prices were marked up slightly in the afternoon on some late buying interest in sympathy with higher prices in Japan. Volume was moderate," a local broker said.
At around 0945 GMT, October RSS3 rose half a cent to 128.75 U.S. cents a kg.
November RSS1 rose one cent to 188.00 Singapore cents (US$1.33) a kg.
October TSR20 rose 1.50 cents to 177.00 Singapore cents (US$1.25) a kg.
